definition: to have a pair of prescription glasses made
to join/to fit/to mate/to mix/to match/to deserve/to make up (a prescription)/to allocate
eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)

sentences.english: An optician is qualified to examine your eyes and prescribe glasses.
sentences.chinese: 眼科醫生有資格來檢查你的眼睛並給你配眼鏡。

sentences.english: An optician is qualified to examine your eyes and prescribe glasses.
sentences.chinese: 驗光師有資格檢查你的眼睛及配眼鏡。

sentences.english: Is matching glasses taller than him eyesight good low still good?
sentences.chinese: 配眼鏡是比自己視力高的好還是低的好？

sentences.english: If glasses were never prescribed, the myopia would stop at a modest amount.
sentences.chinese: 如果從來不配眼鏡，近視眼可能適度停止。

sentences.english: I know of a big optometrist store nearby.
sentences.chinese: 我知道這附近就有一家配眼鏡的店。

sentences.english: Would you like to see eye doctor or optometrist?
sentences.chinese: 請問您是檢查眼睛還是配眼鏡？

sentences.english: If you need glasses, you should see an optometrist.
sentences.chinese: 若是你要配眼鏡，你要找去驗光師。

sentences.english: Check to make sure he doesn't need glasses.
sentences.chinese: 帶孩子去看眼科醫生，看是否應該給他配眼鏡。

definition: to force sb to buy or sell/to trade using coercion
lit. the river that divides Chu and Han/fig. a line that divides rival territories/the mid-line between sides on a Chinese chessboard
lit. to draw a gourd from the model (idiom)/fig. to copy sth mechanically without attempt at originality
When you enter a country, follow the local customs (idiom); do as the natives do/When in Rome, do as the Romans do
